title: grim and gloomy
text:
Visited here on a Friday afternoon ,,
Ticket desk abandoned , no staff to be found , so had to use the awful ticket machine , that just would not behave . Was on the point of giving up when it finally allowed me some tickets , but not at the seats I selected .
The whole experience not improved by how dark it was in there , a cinema darkened to see the screen I understand but this was the entrance area for crying out load . I could have done with a torch .
And grim? Did I mention the toilets. There is a form in the toilet saying when it was last inspected.
I think on this occasion the criteria used was “is it a sh*thole? “ TICK.

title: Alls well
text:
Stayed here one night on a secret escapes deal , having previously visited for a bar snack and drink whilst passing through .
It was January so it was very quiet with partner and I being the only guests staying , that said in the evening the restaurant was about 40% full .
Quality food and Ale served by presentable and friendly staff , what’s is not to like .
A quality gastro pub type affair and far better than my locally starred restaurant , you felt like you had had a substantial meal , perfect for a cold winters night .
Stayed in room 1 , inside the pub , No complaints whatsoever .

title: Fine Pho
text:
Ate here on a Saturday lunchtime , indulging myself with the excellent pho bo , with the wife going for the Pho ga pimped up with fish and chilli sauce . Excellent .
Sides of squid and brilliant spring rolls complemented well.
Will visit again .

title: 4 * Tourist standard
text:
1st meal on the edge of Plaka , cheap draught beer but this does seem to vary in price at the weekend ( it goes up of course ) . Simple Greek food that we found wholly edible .
Typical of that area of Plaka , I suspect no better or worse than anywhere else.

title: Our GO TO place
text:
Our restaurant of choice in Athens as we ate here maybe 4 times in a week .
You are offered bottled water on seating , which we declined and they brought a jug of tap water instead , this was not wanted as we brink BEER and lots of it .
Its many years since I have been in Greece and the beer situation has improved greatly .
It used to be just Amstel and Heineken , German influence on the brewing industry apparently but now there are some excellent Hellenic lagers to be had , its not beer as a Brit would know it but a great deal better than it was.
The Bottled Alpha would be my choice .
On seating you are given a plate of Tomato , garlic , oil and herbs , the only way to eat this is with a truly fresh pitta bread , you can see these being made in the window and to be honest its simply delicious , a starter in itself .
The salads are large enough to share and the mains are a generous portion .
The deserts , traditional dairy based and delicious ( Crème caramel and Kazandibi stand out ).
The staff , young , multilingual and app equipped , hence the fast service .
I have nothing but praise for the place .

title: Yes , friendly place
text:
Simple , tidy and clean café offering a few Greek essentials , what does make it stand out is the friendly boss. He claims to have little English , but he has enough and considerably more that my Greek .
Good place for a cold Alpha , recommended
Yamas.

title: An Athens essential
text:
Typically of me , I arrive to see an ancient monument I hate this systems to find it covered in scaffolding not to me .
Arrived at 10 am and things well busy already up to your neck in people

title: An Athens essential
text:
Typically of me , I arrive to see an ancient monument I hate this systems to find it covered in scaffolding not to me .
Arrived at 10 am and things well busy already up to your neck in people

title: When in Athens
text:
After seeing how busy this place gets we decided to do an early morning hit and be there for opening time , 8 am on the day we choose
Well worth the effort to be able to see the exhibits without a sea of fellow visitors in your way .
Spent about an hour an a half here and numbers only just starting to increase .

title: Fave spot for a spot of sparkling
text:
Ideal place for pre dinner drinks when in Athens , smart set up with helpful , knowledgeable and English speaking staff who advised us on several of the Greek sparking wines they had available , of which there was at least a dozen .
Also had extensive French and a number of Spanish and Italian wines , but as it was Athens we stuck to the local varieties and was truly impressed.

title: Lokanta revived
text:
Have eaten here many times over many years , the lakanta has had a refurb ,
You still enter via front of shop but it all looks that bit more tidy .
Dry now , so no Efes unfortunately but a passable Ayran sufficed
And the kebabs are still good.

title: On the plot
text:
Stayed here for a week whilst visiting Athens and to be honest the UFH ( Urban frame hotel ) was perfect for our needs , right on the plot at the edge of the Plaka district giving you a less that 10 mins walk to the Acropolis .
You are just over 5 mins from the central square of Syntagma square where you can get either a tube or bus to/ from the airport
The rooms bright , scrupulously clean and airy . The 24 hour reception very helpful and informative .
The breakfast simple but it contains the essentials of OJ and Coffee , maybe could do with a spot of Granola to go with that excellent yoghurt , but I am being picky .

Highly recommended .

title: Okay
text:
We had a few beers here in the last few days and to be honest the beer was a little variable . The pagan blonde was poor but the Consett far better so I cannot determine
where the fault lies . I will just have to give it another go

title: Best beer in Warkworth
text:
Of the 4 pubs in Warkworth we visited this had the best beer , Northumbrian ale as well .
Tidy bar with excellent and enthusiastic young staff.
Ate in the restaurant too which should be commended for its healthy portioned classics.
Recommended.

title: Well worth finding
text:
Stopped here for lunch with my better half and was quite impressed .
Inside it is very cosy , with a woodburner in the corner for inclement weather .
Fish based menu , which is overstating the obvious that looked and smelt very good with my partner and I going for the seafood chowder which was rich with plump mussels and chunks of haddock in a creamy sauce wit new potatoes and peas shoots . Quite delicious .
It did say it came with homemade bread , not so certain about that . As a home sourdough baker for the last 8 years I would have said that was a chopped up bloomer of commercial origin .
Better to describe it as crusty and on the days you do get to make it yourselves , your customers are in for an extra treat .
The fish shack also benefits from good staff and tasty beer , happy to give it another go when I can

title: There are far better places to eat in warkworth
text:
Popped in for lunch as a couple , starters of pate and brie came with a perfunctory salad , straight out of the bag with little finesse .
Mains of fishcake , salmon and sea bass apparently and liver and bacon were delivered without any love at all . My main was far to salty to eat and I left at least 70% of it .
That said , the beer was fine so go for a pint but I would eat elsewhere .

title: 1st Class Delivery
text:
We stayed here for 2 night in August and were both very impressed . Your hosts are very amenable and will do their upmost to help with any issues that you might have .
The building , as the name suggest is old and decorated in a quite charming fashion. Our room , at the top of the house being both bright and comfortable and the breakfast / dinning area has been appointed with an eye to the instagramers out there. Very photogenic.
Top marks for the food quality with special marks for the excellent Craster Kippers , whose wonderful almost peaty smokiness is a national treasure and the ingredients of the “full Northumbrian” .
Also top marks to the bistro evening meal , if you are in Warkworth of a Friday or Saturday evening we highly recommend it . I hope to place a separate review for the bistro at a future date.
Congratulations to both H & R for an excellent stay
place: Warkworth Old Post Office Bed and Breakfast

title: Our "Go To " place for beer
text:
We ate here several times in Prague as it was close to our apartment and also it was tucked away just far enough to be quiet away from the masses .
Great beer ( well you are in Prague ) including a nice beer taster that even the other half enjoyed , Great staff ( always a plus ) and some very tasty Czech dishes .
Duck N sauerkraut being a favorite , honey cake Not bad either .

title: The Best meal we had in Prague
text:
Ate here a few times whilst in Prague . Starter was the beetroot , goats cheese and walnut salad . My main was the divine Beef cheeks with a very butter pomme puree , whilst the other half went for smoked duck breast . Finished with a diving dark chocolate and blackcurrant cake , which was to die for.
I did have breakfast one morning where the "hollandaise" was a bit of a challenge I will not repeat but generally , quite impressed

title: Dump
text:
Attended UFO last orders tour here and frankly in 40 years of seeing UFO this was the worst venue I have been to for any band in many years .
Shambolic inside with disinterested staff . I will not return.

title: Solid
text:
Ate here on a Friday night and was reasonably impressed. fast , effective and polite service delivering solid interpretations of bistro dishes . Put the green salad with your steak and jobs a good one .
Service charge included and in this instance , was happy to pay

title: Unsurprisingly a fish based menu
text:
Stopped here as part of a package that included an allowance for dinning . Excellent service due to their very good staff . Nice starter and excellent mussels . I think the acid
from the blueberries in the creme brulee nearly caused a split but it tasted fine .
I found the whole hotel very warm and a plethora of log burners meant I struggled to be comfortable , but that may be just me .

title: Nice beer
text:
Popped in here on a Tuesday lunchtime and things were quiet , what does one expect .
Roaring log burner a few beers and a ploughmas lunch , all quiet reasonable .
The Donnington ale was well kept

title: Fair , but could be a bit loud
text:
Ate here on a Friday afternoon and to be honest the food was okay to good , nothing to really shout about but nothing inedible either. Starters okay , Liver parfait really quite generous . As for mains, I did enjoy the belly pork with it pot of gravy .
The venue is something of a cavernous barn , all hard surfaces and though there were several families in there it was just one close to me with an extremely loud 2 or 3 year old who could have done with calming down , that caused issue .
If I was intending to stay longer I would have moved . So loud I just wanted to get out of there , which is a unfortunate reflection on food and service .

title: Good ale
text: Popped in here for a few pints ( ok , they were in fact 0.5 l , but it just does not scan ) and was impressed by the beer anyway . A couple of draughts on and some of the more unusual ales bottled . Impressed , if I lived her it would become a Friday night staple .

title: The 5 star 4 star
text:
Stayed here for a few days in November 2018 and found it faultless . Good staff , good location , clean and comfortable rooms . very little not to like .
Basement breakfast room a little small but active staff keep the tables moving and I always found somewhere to sit , so ,no problems

title: Clean and competent
text:
Stopped here for a few days whilst in Porto and was happily impressed. Located up by trindade metro station , so easy to find if you take the metro from the airport and about 1km from the river .
Helpful excellent staff , wonderful room ( for the hotel grade ) , both clean and comfortable.
The usual subterranean breakfast room , this one being above the average as it has a window wall to the outside , which alleviates the standard feeling of claustrophobia these things can engender . Good breakfast.
Recommend .

.

title: on the up
text:
Ate here one evening in Nov 2018 . Bread , Olives and jamon , Caldo soup and steaks , Tuna for her and something more bovine for me. good staff and a very tidy and clean restaurant .
A lot to recommend it .

title: Disappointing , try elsewhere
text:
grabbed some food here one evening in November 2018 and frankly we both wished we had not .
We both had the polvo to start . This octopus salad was a little unloved , some seasoning a little more oil and maybe a squeeze of lemon could have infused a bit of life into the dish .
Unfortunately we both found our mains , inedible . dry pork and , what my wife felt , were the least fresh sardines she has ever tried.
Beer was fine , maybe they should focus on that

title: I'd give it 5
text:
Ate here a few times whist in Porto , My first francesinha , some excellent empanadas , and my first of many Nata. Clean , tidy and busy with Locals and tourists, with friendly staff
A lot to recommend it really

title: Worthy of a star
text:
Ate here one lunch time in November2018 , taking advantage of their excellent specials menu . A Chorizo, broad bean and Morcilla stew , Pork loin ( so succulent ) for Me , Delicate cuttlefish for Her and Portuguese pudim for both.
Excellent food and Superior quality staff showed this place to be alongside a few 1 starts I have visited.
Bravo

title: Going that extra mile
text: Popped in again , for Breakfast and was more than pleased . Served by the ever amiable Amy to My breakfast of choice ;-) and a decent coffee . Misses was happy too , well it keeps her out of the kitchen .

title: Has the right feel
text:
Had lunch here a few weeks ago and given the small scale of the operation they have was quite impressed . I had the Pho Bo . Given the first time I had this dish I was 20 years ago sitting on a plastic stool , on the street in Hanoi the takeaway with tables style of "Taste Vietnam" felt very authentic .
I will definitely give it another go . They have no drinks license which is a shame because a "la Rue" or 2 would have washed this down nicely.

title: Spotted a "Missed Steak" on the breakfast menu
text:
As per title , new breakfast menu is extremely parred down and my favorite has been removed.
Always bemused by things like that as "steak " becomes available again at midday and it is not as though there is a time lock on the fridge.
Time to get the grill pan out and do it myself I suppose.

title: Could be great
text:
Stopped here for a few night whilst in the area and was initially impressed by the building and room . Very characterful and charming and we stayed in room 15 , which is in the stable block. The room was both pleasant and clean with only the shower cubicle area showing its age . Not bad just , like us all a little more tired than we used to be .
The only draw back we suffered from was you are not too far from smokers corner so even on a Monday night , retiring early was not too successful . Not the smell of smoke but the inane chatter of the smokers meant we did not get any peace until well after 11pm. I think this was mostly down to one guest who would wander around chatting all too loudly into his phone. He did this in the morning as well .
A more discrete and separate smoking shelter would be useful , can I suggest the middle of the river?
Breakfast was okay but we both found the Eggs Benedict a little sharp on the palate.
I tend to use lemon juice as the souring agent for the hollandaise and think the chef may have used white wine vinegar instead , which is valid but I think there may have been more vinegar used with the poached eggs and the overall effect was a little too much. No such issues with the full English which was as it should be .
We also used the restaurant in the evenings ( excellent bar and dinning room presentation supported by superb staff ) .
One evenings Flank/bavette steak was right on the money but the lamb assiette I found disappointing . I read that there may be a new chef on site so a few settling errors are bound to occur but all in all not bad .

title: use your noodle and give it a go
text: Popped in here for a quick lunch and was pleasantly pleased . Tidy dining room and efficient and well presented staff mark this place out . Part of a larger arrangement the noodle bar sits happily in the middle of it all . Simple menu provided both my wife and I with good ramen dishes . Her's salmon and mine , belly pork based and some good draught beer . I would visit again and go for something more extensive.

title: A game of two halves
text: Popped in here for a Monday lunch and though quickly seated things slowed down a bit after that . We ordered a pot of tea and 2 identical mains and things took there time even though I would say the venue was less then 25 % full . What arrived was perfectly adequate and the service was nice and polite , just slow.

title: Sombre
text: This artificial island was built to commemorate the Belorussian/ Minsk dead of the soviet incursion into Afghanistan and hence is never going to be a barrel of laughs. Touching that it is so "not hidden " Given the west boycott of the 1980 Olympics due to this incursion and what has happened since , the irony is not lost

title: Grill man par excellence
text:
Ate here a few times as the title suggests , here they really know how to cook meat ( n fish ).
Whether it be the fillet steak , Tuna steak , a dish that was something akin to a Pork escalope cordon bleu , its Chicken equivalent or the “stuffed burger “ , which I think was some kind of Pljeskavica, nothing was served up that was less than excellent .
Not my normal kind of place but I was drawn in by the counter , something like a butchers shop display where you could select what you wanted by weight and have it cooked to order .
Cheap, cheerful and tasty and as its Split , who minds being outside.

title: authentic feel
text: Ate here one lunchtime after visiting the nearby Mir castle, which I found over restored and furnished with whatever could be found. This however felt a lot more rustic and real with a lot of classic Belorussian dishes . Enjoy.

title: The dogs whatsits ..
text: Had one evening meal here and was mightily impressed . It may be a bit twee in style but the straightforward honesty of the food shines through. Good salad , excellent mushroom and barley soup , more draniki and cherry cheesecake , well and truly stuffed.

title: When in Minsk , eat local
text: Draniki, is named after a local potato dish , i think , so there seemed little point in trying anything else other than that . Young friendly staff who speak well accented English but perhaps a bit limited in vocabulary , the menu is in Belorussian . But as said , if you go for the headline dish you will not go wrong . There are plenty of spud pancake types of dish here and this was possibly the best we tried , with some excellent beer and some excellent cherry liqueur .

title: Craft beer shop
text:
As per title , very on the money at the moment with the beer bar vibe that seems global.
Interesting beer list with a few old favourites but I stuck to the local varieties , lively and not cheap , but when is craft beer cheap

title: Go for it
text:
One of the nearest restaurants to hotel Belarus where we were staying , see separate review .
Décor and menus have changed since some of these photos were taken but this is the location but I can thoroughly recommend it. There are now some English menu’s available , spoken English limited but you will get by using the item numbers to order . Good sized portions of local wholesome food and some very fine beers . very much like they have a tap to a local micro brewery . Wheat beer , dark beer and some excellent cherry beer

title: Not bad at all, worth stopping for a half ( liter )
text:
Stopped here one evening whilst wandering the old town . Clearly quite popularist we gave it a go .
Good beer , something Belarus does do well everywhere in my limited experience and reasonable food . English menu with pics , totally edible and staff with enough English for you to get by . Visit with confidence.

title: Good cheap beer
text:
Now renamed to the “Just Beer Bar “ or JBB sits on a corner not far from my hotel where it exudes an American dinner vibe Not exactly PC or tasteful , , not that I have ever been to the states.
We popped in here for initially a drink but also ate. . Not my traditional type of stop , but frankly , we were knackered .
Friendly service from the waitress but do spare her blushes , it must get cold in that uniform. Reasonable food and very cheap beer with a couple of draughts brewed specifically for JBB and a menu showing 34 types of draught beer
When in the Ukraine drink Ukrainian beer and if you go for the cheapest that’s about £1.05 a pint but go for the special ,its worth it

title: Its Staff are its stars
text:
Stayed here recently and was well impressed by the experience .
Though the hotel may look a little dated in that old intourist way the staff are bang on the money being helpful and informative giving you good information about the city . Location very much a plus point too

title: Good but could be more welcoming
text:
Ate here recently and was impressed by the range and quality of food if not by the warmth of my welcome. You are opposite the football stadium and I do not know if this coloured things in some way
Ate several classic eastern European dishes but was disappointed they only had German beer on my visit .

title: Kiev favourite
text:
Ate here a few time recently in Kiev as the place was recommended by my hotels reception staff .
Easy to find with a quirky layout and interesting brik a brac . I skipped on the “lard menu” as I just don’t know what I am doing with that but excellent borscht for a starter was superb .
I wished I had more time to work through the entire menu , Not cheap by Ukrainian standards but more that reasonable by ours. Recommended .

title: Its all about the borscht
text:
Ate here one lunchtime and we went for the classics , Ukrainian borscht , Pielmienie and cheesecake.
The place is bright, clean with welcoming staff and provided a satisfying lunch.
As the title really , its all about the borscht Ukrainian style , which I much prefer to the more vivid red variety . I am not saying this is the best I have ever tasted , but for the UK it did the trick heady as it was with dill.
I love the way it changes from consommé clarity to a vivid pink as the beetroot and sour cream combine . Sublime and a classic dish and I shall visit again.

title: Bull Bay Vista
text:
Stayed here recently on 2 night travelzoo deal . Stayed in the excellent room 3 which benefits to windows on 2 aspects so you get a stunning view in a bright and airy room.
Hotel located about a mile out of Amlwch itself but is easily found and is a small but tidy family ran affair which provided an excellent platform to exploring Anglesey for the first time and was very good value . Something that you can not often say in the UK.

title: A superior chipper for sure
text:
Ate here a few times whilst in “oh so pretty Beaumaris “ recently and received competently cooked food and superior service. Admittedly both times were well with service hours and we ate upstairs in the bistro rather than the “chipper” itself Over the course of the 2 occasion we tried the Menai Mussels , white bait , seafood chowder and Cod . All very much on the money . Its not a Magpie , but then again few places are but we experienced none of the negatives that are listed by others ,.
Worth a go .

title: Nothing looney tunes about this place
text:
Looking for a light lunch around Newark as we had plans for the evening and spotted this place
My wife and I both had the pork burrito which was excellent , fully loaded but we mistakenly had the mildly spiced version , a bit of salsa would have pushed it to another level .
The Latino behind the counter was welcoming and deserves to do well .
Sombreros on the wall that you can wear to get into the spirit of the place
I think if I worked in Newark this would become an addictive treat

title: London gin bar prices and poor ale
text:
Tried this one Friday afternoon as it looked quite smart but found it a little bit more style over content
She had a expensive gin and I had a very nasty pint Not a drinkers pub I am afraid and unlikely to return

title: In need of a spruce up
text: Popped in for a pint as its style and location do make it hard to miss . My £3 pint was not that bad and one of the cheaper ones to be had around here to be honest . The place itself feels in need of a deep steam clean and a lick of paint

title: Ok ish
text:
Nice venue in a good location but possibly a bit light academically , this not being a pun on the co located tudor school
Pleasant enough but a bit more junior school focused than one might like , with plenty of touch screens to keep the iPAD generation happy
The TE Lawrence exhibition did contain at least one mistake that I spotted , the calibre of which , ( big clue ) , I will leave for other to spot
Cost wise? Not cheap but places like this never are
place: National Civil War Centre Newark Museum

title: Photogenic , but most castle ruins are
text:
Worth a half hour of your time to take a walk around . Also worth crossing over the other side of the river for a few shots from that aspect .
Generally pretty and you can see why is a favourite for photographs when the recently betrothed emerge from the nearby registry office

title: Not the worst spoons
text:
Visited here for a few pints overs the weekend and though generally better than my local spoons as staff were quick to serve and I actually saw dirty plates and glasses collected, it could have been better . The thing that really let then down was the collection of lab rats/ crash test dummies stood in the door way smoking , and I do mean in the door way , within the plot line of the building.
The odd bucket of water needs to be thrown over them to encourage them away from the building for this nasty habit , otherwise a purpose built shelter for them in nearby Lincoln would suit

title: Boutique Hotel set up
text:
Stayed here for a couple of night at end of Jan2018 in the delightful room 8 which was both spacious and well decorated although off some highly vertiginous stairs
The Inn has a marvellous boutique feel with an eclectic style of decor and small car park which suited me fine
Breakfast is extensive ( two sides of A4 for the menu ) and they had black sheep on draught , so what could be better?
Answer? A little more organisation maybe . They were going through staff changes when we arrived and it did reflect in a few glitches . My wife made the booking and on arrival I asked for my card to be used . Unfortunately this did not happen and her card was still debited , Minor detail and I am sure things will stabilise

All in all , nice place and nice people

title: Good food and Good People but if using a sat nav to find , read on
text:
Stayed here for two night recently and was impressed by the standards. Stayed in the corvus room which is lovely with a bath & shower combination on suite.
We ate here on both evenings and was impressed by both portion size ( Northern ) and costs
One night, a carvery with more veg than you could wave a stick and on the other a fish pie as big as my head again with a surfeit of veg. it did defeat me
The only problem I had , was finding the place . Apparently it has been reregistered for a post code as my car nav , in a car less than a month old puts the given post code not in byers green but in sperrymoor , 3 miles away Best to use DL16 7NX for a pub on the same street , that worked for me.
